titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Horace Littlefield Papers Related to "Portrait Drawings of Poets, and Their Manuscripts" Exhibition
Littlefield (William Horace) Papers Related to "Portrait Drawings of Poets, and Their Manuscripts" Exhibition
titlestmt.author: by Danijela True and Jennifer Meehan

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 04:50

did.unittitle: William Horace Littlefield papers related to "Portrait Drawings of Poets, and Their Manuscripts" exhibition

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collections consists of artwork, manuscripts, correspondence, and other material relating to William Horace Littlefield's exhibition "Portrait Drawings of Poets, and Their Manuscripts" (1942). The bulk of the collection is comprised of the original portrait drawings and mounted autograph and typescript manuscripts of American and British poets displayed in the exhibit. According to an artist note found in the collection, "the drawings are portrait heads in pencil on grey-green paper, modelled in white and grey, the medium being water in oil tempera. Each is signed and dated by poet and artist." Correspondence includes letters from poets responding to Littlefield's request to sit for a portrait, as well as more general correspondence. Other material includes writings by Littlefield and printed material related to the exhibit.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Stiner, 1985.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The William Horace Littlefield Papers Related to "Portrait Drawings of Poets, and Their Manuscripts" Exhibition is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William Horace Littlefield Papers Related to "Portrait Drawings of Poets, and Their Manuscripts" Exhibition. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection received initial processing at or around the time of acquisition. Further description was carried out in 2012.
Formerly classed as: Uncat ZA MS 322.

bioghist.head: William Horace Littlefield (1902-1969)
bioghist.p: William Horace Littlefield, American painter, writer, and art collector. Littlefield was born in Roxbury, Massachusetts in 1902, and was educated at Harvard University (A.B., 1924). His exhibition, "Portrait Drawings of Poets, and Their Manuscript" (1942), featured fourteen portraits of contemporary American and British poets displayed in conjunction with autograph and typescript manuscripts of each poet. Featured poets included: William Abrahams, John Peale Bishop, John Malcolm Brinnin, John Ciardi, Richard Eberhart, Dudley Fitts, Robert Hillyers, John Holmes, Samuel French Morse, Howard Moss, Winfield Townley Scott, Theodore Spencer, Dunston Thompson, Robert Penn Warren, and Edward Weismiller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collections consists of artwork, manuscripts, correspondence, and other material relating to William Horace Littlefield's exhibition "Portrait Drawings of Poets, and Their Manuscripts" (1942). The bulk of the collection is comprised of the original portrait drawings and mounted autograph and typescript manuscripts of American and British poets displayed in the exhibit. According to an artist note found in the collection, "the drawings are portrait heads in pencil on grey-green paper, modelled in white and grey, the medium being water in oil tempera. Each is signed and dated by poet and artist." Correspondence includes letters from poets responding to Littlefield's request to sit for a portrait, as well as more general correspondence. Other material includes writings by Littlefield and printed material related to the exhibit.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: I. Artwork and Manuscripts, 1940-1954. II. Correspondence and Other Papers, 1932-1977.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized by format. Correspondence is arranged alphabetically by correspondent.
